text:
Burr Oak is a city in Jewell County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 174 people lived there.
History.
Burr Oak was planned out in 1871. It was incorporated as a city in 1880. It was named after the Burr Oak Creek.
The first post office in Burr Oak was created in June 1871.
Geography.
Burr Oak is at (39.868516, -98.304297). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 174 people, 93 households, and 50 families living in Burr Oak.
Education.
Burr Oak is part of USD 107 Rock Hills. Burr Oak became a part of Rock Hills USD 107 in Mankato in 2006. The Rock Hills High School mascot is Grizzlies.
